question: A block of certain mass is placed on a rough floor. The coefficients of static and kinetic friction between the block and the floor are 0.4 and 0.25 respectively. A constant horizontal force <katex>$F=20$</katex> N acts on it so that the velocity of the block varies with time according to the following graph. The mass of the block is nearly (Take <katex>$g=10\text{ ms}^{-2}$</katex>)
images/q2_graph.png
explanation: The equation of motion is <katex>$F - f_k = ma$</katex>, where <katex>$f_k = \mu_k mg$</katex>.
